content: There are many accounts of leaders interacting with everyday people in the aftermath of a revolution. For example, after the French Revolution, former King Louis XVI was put on trial and ultimately executed by guillotine. During his trial, he reportedly engaged in conversations with members of the public, including some of his former subjects, who came to see him. Another example is the Russian Revolution, in which former Tsar Nicholas II and his family were imprisoned and eventually killed by the Bolshevik regime. There are accounts of the Tsar and his family interacting with their guards and other members of the public during their imprisonment. These interactions provide a glimpse into the ways in which leaders can be brought down from their positions of power and forced to confront the realities of everyday life.
